{{Infobox university | name = American University of Malta | native_name = <!-- SOURCE?? Università Amerikana ta' Malta --> | native_name_lang = mt | image = Dock no. 1.jpg | caption = Renovation works at the Cospicua campus in November 2016 | former_name = American Institute of Malta | type = [[Private university|Private]] | established = {{start date and age|2016|09|16|df=y}}<ref name="ourbeginnings"/> | founder = Sadeen Education Investment Ltd. | provost = [[John Ryder (scholar)|John Ryder]] | students = {{circa}} 15–23 | city = [[Cospicua]] | country = [[Malta]] | coordinates = {{Coord|35|52|55|N|14|31|11.2|E|display=inline, title}} | website = [http://www.aum.edu.mt/ aum.edu.mt] | logo = American University of Malta logo.png }}
The '''American University of Malta''' ('''AUM''') is a [[private university|private]], American-style [[liberal arts college]] in [[Cospicua]], [[Malta]]. The establishment of the educational institution was announced in May 2015, and the project is meant to regenerate the South of Malta and give said area an economic and social boost.<ref name=opm-presentation/> Since the proposal was announced, Dock 1 in Cospicua was chosen for the head campus, while extensions are being planned for other sites in Cospicua and Żonqor, [[Marsaskala]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Muscat|first1=Caroline|title=Mounting opposition to use of ODZ land|url=http://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20150514/local/mounting-opposition-to-use-of-odz-land.568095|work=[[Times of Malta]]|date=14 May 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151220233523/http://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20150514/local/mounting-opposition-to-use-of-odz-land.568095|archivedate=20 December 2015}}</ref> It was officially established on 16 September 2016,<ref name="ourbeginnings"/> and it opened in September 2017.<ref name="maltachamber"/>
==Planning and Opening== On 5 May 2015, the [[Jordan]]ian contracting company Sadeen Group and the [[Government of Malta]] signed an agreement at [[Auberge de Castille]] for the former to set up a private educational institution called the American University of Malta (AUM). The university was planned to be set up in [[Spain]], but Prime Minister of Malta [[Joseph Muscat]] persuaded the chairman of Sadeen, Hani Salah, to set it up in Malta. The university is to accommodate 4000 students, primarily from the [[Middle East]], [[North Africa]] and [[Europe]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20150503/local/heads-of-agreement-for-4000-student-american-university-expected-on.566504|title=Heads of agreement for 4,000-student American university expected on Tuesday - timesofmalta.com|date=2015-09-12|access-date=2018-03-05|deadurl=bot: unknown|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150912200657/http://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20150503/local/heads-of-agreement-for-4000-student-american-university-expected-on.566504|archivedate=2015-09-12|df=}}</ref>
By the time all campuses are complete, it is to have schools of business, architecture and design, engineering, arts, sciences, and information technology.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://aum.edu.mt/en/article/5/Our-Beginnings|title=AUM - American University of Malta|date=2018-01-06|access-date=2018-03-05|deadurl=bot: unknown|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180106002945/http://aum.edu.mt/en/article/5/Our-Beginnings|archivedate=2018-01-06|df=}}</ref>
The original curricula of the AUM are provided by the [[DePaul University]]. The latter did not commit any financial resources for the construction of the AUM, and it was not involved in any discussions with the Government of Malta.<ref>{{cite news|title=DePaul University denies involvement in site selection for proposed American University of Malta|url=http://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20150508/local/depaul-university-denies-involvement-in-site-selection-for-proposed.567368|work=[[Times of Malta]]|date=8 May 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150913161255/http://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20150508/local/depaul-university-denies-involvement-in-site-selection-for-proposed.567368|archivedate=13 September 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Mathews|first1=Kristin Claes|title=Faculty create curricula for American University of Malta|url=http://www.depaulnewsline.com/features/faculty-create-curricula-american-university-malta|work=DePaul Newsline|date=13 May 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150520003229/http://www.depaulnewsline.com/features/faculty-create-curricula-american-university-malta|archivedate=20 May 2015}}</ref>
The proposed university is meant to create a social and economic boost to localities in the [[South Eastern Region]] of Malta, which is regarded as being less developed than the rest of the island.<ref name=opm-presentation>{{cite web|title=Investiment għan-naħa t'isfel ta' Malta – American University of Malta|url=https://opm.gov.mt/en/Documents/AUM/AUM%20PRESENTATION.pdf|website=[[Government of Malta]]|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304213220/https://opm.gov.mt/en/Documents/AUM/AUM%20PRESENTATION.pdf|archivedate=4 March 2016|language=Maltese}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Estimation of the Contribution to the Maltese Economy of the Development and Operation of an International Higher Academic Institution: Update Based on a Project Proposal Spread Over Two Sites|url=https://opm.gov.mt/en/Documents/AUM/AUM-EIA.pdf|website=[[Government of Malta]]|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160703110407/https://opm.gov.mt/en/Documents/AUM/AUM-EIA.pdf|archivedate=3 July 2016}}</ref> The project has an investment of over €115 million, and it is to create around 400<ref name="opm-presentation" /> to 750 jobs.<ref name="MT0516">{{cite news|url=http://www.maltatoday.com.mt/news/national/64924/american_university_of_malta_campus_to_take_three_years_to_complete#.V3jwKfl961s|title='American University of Malta' campus to take three years to complete|last1=Dalli|first1=Miriam|date=6 May 2016|work=[[Malta Today]]|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160604130547/http://www.maltatoday.com.mt/news/national/64924/american_university_of_malta_campus_to_take_three_years_to_complete|archivedate=4 June 2016}}</ref> The project's estimated economic output rests at about €48 to €85 million.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20160921/local/sadeens-five-year-licence-dictated-by-law.625667|title=Sadeen’s five-year licence 'dictated by law'|last1=Sansone|first1=Kurt|date=21 September 2016|work=[[Times of Malta]]|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160922140626/http://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20160921/local/sadeens-five-year-licence-dictated-by-law.625667|archivedate=22 September 2016}}</ref> Ripple effects of these changes are already being felt. As of September 2016, demand for property in Cospicua has reportedly increased as a result of the university project.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Bartolo|first1=Janice|title=Xhieda li l-American University of Malta bdiet tagħti spinta lin-naħa t'isfel ta' Malta|url=http://www.one.com.mt/news/xhieda-li-l-american-university-of-malta-bdiet-taghti-spinta-lin-naha-tisfel-ta-malta/|work=[[One Productions|One]]|date=27 September 2016|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161019133208/http://www.one.com.mt/news/xhieda-li-l-american-university-of-malta-bdiet-taghti-spinta-lin-naha-tisfel-ta-malta/|archivedate=19 October 2016|language=Maltese}}</ref>
The university originally planned to take in its first students in October 2016, with lectures at [[SmartCity Malta]] until the head campus was completed.<ref name=times2015-08-20/> The beginning of the first academic year was later moved to 28 August 2017, with lectures held at the Dock No. 1 campus in Cospicua.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Sansone|first1=Kurt|title=Lectures at AUM to start on August 28|url=http://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20160925/local/lectures-at-aum-to-start-on-august-28.625991|work=[[Times of Malta]]|date=25 September 2016|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160926154655/http://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20160925/local/lectures-at-aum-to-start-on-august-28.625991|archivedate=26 September 2016}}</ref>
In January 2016, [[John Ryder (scholar)|John Ryder]] was named as the head of the American Institute of Malta.<ref>{{cite news|title=Former Baku university rector to head 'American Institute of Malta'|url=http://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20160127/local/former-baku-university-rector-to-head-american-institute-of-malta.600270|work=Times of Malta|date=26 January 2016}}</ref>
===Location of campus and use of ODZ land=== [[File:Site for the future American Institute of Malta.jpeg|thumb|Żonqor Point, where part of the university campus is to be built]]
When the university project was announced in May 2015, the government offered the Sadeen Group {{convert|90000|m2|abbr=on}} of Outside Development Zone (ODZ) land near Żonqor Point in [[Marsaskala]] on which to build the university. A natural park, partially funded by the university, would be set up nearby. The proposal to use ODZ land raised concerns among environmentalists, including the NGOs [[Flimkien għal Ambjent Aħjar]], [[Friends of the Earth]] Malta, Ramblers Association, [[Din l-Art Ħelwa]], NatureTrust Malta, [[Birdlife]] Malta, Malta Organic Agriculture Movement and Greenhouse. The Malta Developers Association also stated that a better site should be found,<ref name=times2015-05-05>{{cite news|title=Fort San Leonardo may be incorporated in new university campus|url=http://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20150505/local/update-3-fort-san-leonardo-may-be-incorporated-in-new-university.566883|work=[[Times of Malta]]|date=5 May 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150928173056/http://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20150505/local/update-3-fort-san-leonardo-may-be-incorporated-in-new-university.566883|archivedate=28 September 2015}}</ref> while the Church criticized the process used to select the land for the university.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Muscat|first1=Caroline|title=Church slams government’s handling of university bid|url=http://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20150521/local/church-slams-governments-handling-of-university-bid.569018|work=[[Times of Malta]]|date=21 May 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151220213628/http://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20150521/local/church-slams-governments-handling-of-university-bid.569018|archivedate=20 December 2015}}</ref> Meanwhile, residents of Marsaskala and southern Malta supported the university project by signing a petition in its favour.<ref>{{cite news|title=Tan-nofsinhar jiġbru petizzjoni favur il-proġett tal-università|url=http://www.inewsmalta.com/dart/20150615-tan-nofsinhar-ji-bru-petizzjoni-favur-il-pro-ett-tal-universit|work=iNews Malta|date=16 June 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150618014128/http://www.inewsmalta.com/dart/20150615-tan-nofsinhar-ji-bru-petizzjoni-favur-il-pro-ett-tal-universit|archivedate=18 June 2015|language=Maltese}}</ref>
The government initially planned to include the 19th-century [[Fort Leonardo]] within the university campus. Prime Minister Joseph Muscat also stated that constructing the university in Marsaskala would pressure the owners of the former [[Jerma Palace Hotel]] to redevelop the site, which has fallen into disrepair since being closed down in 2007.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Dalli|first1=Kim|title=University plan ‘puts pressure on Jerma site’|url=http://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20150506/local/university-plan-puts-pressure-on-jerma-site.566951|work=[[Times of Malta]]|date=6 May 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150929031031/http://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20150506/local/university-plan-puts-pressure-on-jerma-site.566951|archivedate=29 September 2015}}</ref>
Muscat responded to the environmentalists' criticism by stating that the [[Malta Environment and Planning Authority]] would consider other sites as long as they are located in the southern part of the island.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Martin|first1=Ivan|title=‘University will generate €25m a year’|url=http://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20150504/local/university-will-generate-25m-a-year.566645|work=[[Times of Malta]]|date=4 May 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151220195817/http://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20150504/local/university-will-generate-25m-a-year.566645|archivedate=20 December 2015}}</ref> A public consultation process was subsequently made in order to select an alternative site for the university campus.<ref>{{cite web|title=The American University of Malta – Preliminary Alternative Sites Evaluation Report|url=https://opm.gov.mt/en/Documents/AUM/Preliminary%20Alternative%20Sites%20Evaluation%20Report.pdf|website=[[Government of Malta]]|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304214404/https://opm.gov.mt/en/Documents/AUM/Preliminary%20Alternative%20Sites%20Evaluation%20Report.pdf|archivedate=4 March 2016|date=August 2015}}</ref>
On 23 May 2015, the Front Ħarsien ODZ ([[Maltese language|Maltese]] for ''Front for the Protection of ODZ'') was set up in response to the proposed development at Żonqor Point. The group aims to protect all ODZ land in Malta, and it includes then-[[Labour Party (Malta)|Labour]] MP, turned Democratic Party (PD) members, [[Marlene Farrugia]], [[Whip (politics)|government whip]] Godfrey Farrugia and former [[Alternattiva Demokratika]] politician, turned Nationalist Party (PN) member, [[Michael Briguglio]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Camilleri|first1=Neil|title=Godfrey, Marlene Farrugia join 'Front Harsien ODZ,' group says Zonqor project can be stopped|url=http://www.independent.com.mt/articles/2015-05-23/local-news/Front-Harsien-ODZ-launched-not-just-against-Zonqor-university-but-all-other-ODZ-developments-6736136030|work=[[The Malta Independent]]|date=23 May 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150811133750/http://www.independent.com.mt/articles/2015-05-23/local-news/Front-Harsien-ODZ-launched-not-just-against-Zonqor-university-but-all-other-ODZ-developments-6736136030|archivedate=11 August 2015}}</ref> On 20 June, the front held a protest in [[Valletta]] against the development, and it was attended by 3000 people.<ref>{{cite news|title=Government announces reduced university plans for Zonqor|url=http://www.maltatoday.com.mt/news/national/56337/government_announces_reduced_university_plans_for_zonqor_#.VncO4PkrLIV|work=[[Malta Today]]|date=20 August 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151010090820/http://www.maltatoday.com.mt/news/national/56337/government_announces_reduced_university_plans_for_zonqor_|archivedate=10 October 2015}}</ref>
On 20 August, Muscat announced that the government had reached an agreement with the Sadeen Group that the campus be split between the former [[Malta Dockyard|Dock No. 1]] in [[Cospicua]] and a reduced site at Żonqor Point. The campus at Żonqor is much smaller than the one originally planned, and it will occupy the site of the water polo pitch and {{convert|18000|m2|abbr=on}} of adjoining ODZ fields. This campus is to consist of three faculties and student dormitories, with a maximum height of five stories. A new water polo pitch is also to be built to replace the one that will be demolished to make way for the university. The campus at Cospicua will occupy two former [[warehouse]]s at Dock No. 1 which were built during [[Knights Hospitaller|Hospitaller]] and [[British Empire|British]] rule. Additional buildings are to be constructed, but they are to keep with the architectural style of the area.<ref name=times2015-08-20>{{cite news|title='American' University to occupy Dock 1 buildings and reduced Zonqor site|url=http://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20150820/local/update-3-american-university-to-occupy-dock-1-buildings-and-reduced.581335|work=[[Times of Malta]]|date=20 August 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150911141423/http://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20150820/local/update-3-american-university-to-occupy-dock-1-buildings-and-reduced.581335|archivedate=11 September 2015}}</ref> This restoration project is bringing an otherwise run down Dock no. 1 back on its feet, which had been abandoned with the end of the rule of the British. The government will rent out both campuses to Sadeen Group for around €200,000 a year.<ref>{{cite news|title=Government to rent public land to American University of Malta on the cheap|url=http://www.independent.com.mt/articles/2015-08-30/local-news/Government-to-rent-public-land-to-American-University-of-Malta-on-the-cheap-6736141281|work=[[The Malta Independent]]|date=30 August 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151016154148/http://www.independent.com.mt/articles/2015-08-30/local-news/Government-to-rent-public-land-to-American-University-of-Malta-on-the-cheap-6736141281|archivedate=16 October 2015}}</ref>
Front Ħarsien ODZ said that the proposal of splitting the campus was better than the original one, but said that it was still unacceptable to build on ODZ land.<ref name=times2015-08-20/> The [[University Students' Council (Malta)|University Students' Council]] also expressed its disappointment at the government building part of the campus at Żonqor Point.<ref>{{cite news|title=KSU disappointed by the governments adamant decision confirming the American University of Malta at Zonqor Point|url=http://www.ksu.org.mt/index.php/press/160-ksu-disappointed-by-the-governments-adamant-decision-confirming-the-american-university-of-malta-at-zonqor-point|work=[[University Students' Council (Malta)|KSU]]|date=28 September 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151220212200/http://www.ksu.org.mt/index.php/press/160-ksu-disappointed-by-the-governments-adamant-decision-confirming-the-american-university-of-malta-at-zonqor-point|archivedate=20 December 2015}}</ref> On the other hand, the move was welcomed by the Cospicua Heritage Society, who said that the [[Three Cities]] and [[Kalkara]] would greatly benefit from the project.<ref>{{cite news|title=Cospicua Heritage Society qed tappoġġja l-proġett tal-università|url=http://www.inewsmalta.com/dart/20150824-cospicua-heritage-society-qed-tappo-ja-pro-ett-tal-universit|work=iNews Malta|date=24 August 2008|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151220234715/http://www.inewsmalta.com/dart/20150824-cospicua-heritage-society-qed-tappo-ja-pro-ett-tal-universit|archivedate=20 December 2015|language=Maltese}}</ref>
The government approved the granting of land for the AUM after a 15-hour long debate in parliament on 15 December 2015.<ref name=times2015-12-15>{{cite news|title=House approves 'American University' property motion after night-long debate|url=http://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20151215/local/aum-undergoing-rigorous-evaluation-education-minister.595847|work=[[Times of Malta]]|date=15 December 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151219174151/http://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20151215/local/aum-undergoing-rigorous-evaluation-education-minister.595847|archivedate=19 December 2015}}</ref> Front Ħarsien ODZ called this parliamentary sitting "surreal" and said that it shows terrible governance.<ref>{{cite news|title=Front slams vote for 'American University'|url=http://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20151216/local/front-slams-vote-for-american-university.595918|work=[[Times of Malta]]|date=16 December 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151219175001/http://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20151216/local/front-slams-vote-for-american-university.595918|archivedate=19 December 2015}}</ref>
[[File:Malta - Cospicua - Fuq San l-Inkurunazzjoni - Dock no1 11 ies.jpg|thumb|The British Building at Dock No. 1 in Cospicua]]
On 25 August 2016, the Planning Authority approved the restoration of the British Building at Dock No. 1, and its conversion into a campus to house part of the AUM. Parts of the building which were destroyed during [[World War II]] will be rebuilt, while an intermediate level and a new second floor with a [[Contemporary architecture|contemporary]] glass-and-steel design will be constructed.<ref>{{cite web|title=University in Cospicua granted permit|url=http://www.pa.org.mt/news-details?id=1137|website=Planning Authority|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160828114710/http://www.pa.org.mt/news-details?id=1137|archivedate=28 August 2016|date=25 August 2016}}</ref> The renovation of the building is entrusted to the architect Edwin Mintoff, and it is expected to be completed by April 2018.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Saliba|first1=Norma|title=American University buildings will reflect the past historic appearance of Cospicua Wharf|url=http://www.tvm.com.mt/en/news/il-binjiet-tal-uaameamerican-university-buildings-will-reflect-the-past-historic-appearance-of-cospicua-wharfrican-university-buildings-will-reflect-the-past-historic-appearance-of-cospicua-wharfm-se/|work=[[TVM (Malta)|TVM]]|date=26 August 2016}}</ref>
There are plans to restore the Knights' Building at Dock No. 1 and convert it into part of the campus, and this renovation is planned to be completed by 2017–18. The Marsaskala campus is to be ready by 2019–20.<ref name="times2016-09-25"/>
===Accreditation and licensing=== In December 2015, Leader of the Opposition [[Simon Busuttil]] stated that since the AUM applied for the licence of a "Higher Education Institution", its marketing of itself as a "University" is illegal.<ref name=times2015-12-15/> In January 2016, the National Commission for Further and Higher Education announced that Sadeen Education Investment Ltd had been given a licence to operate a Higher Education Institution under the name ''American Institute of Malta''. This was the first step in the process to acquire a university licence.<ref name=times2016-01-26>{{cite news|title=American University of Malta formally becomes American Institute of Malta, process to acquire university licence in process|url=http://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20160126/local/american-university-of-malta-formally-becomes-american-institute-of.600155|work=[[Times of Malta]]|date=26 January 2016|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160126174313/http://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20160126/local/american-university-of-malta-formally-becomes-american-institute-of.600155|archivedate=26 January 2016}}</ref> The commission has stated that a degree issued by the American Institute would have the same value as one issued by the University of Malta.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Camilleri|first1=Ivan|title=American Institute's degree 'equivalent to university's'|url=http://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20160201/local/american-institutes-degree-equivalent-to-universitys.600851|work=[[Times of Malta]]|date=1 February 2016|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160201174356/http://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20160201/local/american-institutes-degree-equivalent-to-universitys.600851|archivedate=1 February 2016}}</ref>
However, on 11 March 2016, Sadeen Education Investment Ltd was notified by a judicial letter that licensed higher education institutions are prohibited from using the word "university" in their advertising and publicity, unless they have been granted that status formally.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Vella|first1=Matthew|title=Watchdog fines Sadeen for marketing unlicensed 'university'|url=http://www.maltatoday.com.mt/news/national/63682/watchdog_fines_sadeen_over_aum_logo|work=Malta Today|date=3 April 2016}}</ref> On 6 May 2016, Economy Minister [[Christian Cardona]] said that he had "no doubt that this will be a University and not an institute. This is part of a process, but the project will result in a University".<ref name="Times0516">{{cite news|last1=Martin|first1=Ivan|title=American Institute courses could start this year|url=http://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20160506/local/american-institute-courses-could-start-this-year.611196|work=timesofmalta.com|date=6 May 2016}}</ref>
The National Commission for Higher Education officially accredited the AUM on 30 June 2016, after a 14-month process which included financial and academic evaluations. The commission imposed a number of conditions on the AUM, including an annual audit by the [[Clemson University]].<ref>{{cite news|title=American University of Malta gets accreditation at last|url=http://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20160630/local/american-university-of-malta-gets-accreditation-at-last.617262|work=[[Times of Malta]]|date=30 June 2016|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160701130607/http://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20160630/local/american-university-of-malta-gets-accreditation-at-last.617262|archivedate=1 July 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Sansone|first1=Kurt|title=Conditions imposed on Sadeen Group for university licence 'are not negotiable'|url=http://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20160703/local/conditions-imposed-on-sadeen-group-for-university-licence-are-not.617495|work=[[Times of Malta]]|date=3 July 2016|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160703105715/http://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20160703/local/conditions-imposed-on-sadeen-group-for-university-licence-are-not.617495|archivedate=3 July 2016}}</ref> Sadeen asked for a compromise on these conditions, but the commission insisted that they were not negotiable.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Sansone|first1=Kurt|title=No university licence for Sadeen, one month before 'first student intake'|url=http://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20160910/local/no-university-licence-for-sadeen-one-month-before-first-student-intake.624564|work=[[Times of Malta]]|date=10 September 2016|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160910171108/http://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20160910/local/no-university-licence-for-sadeen-one-month-before-first-student-intake.624564|archivedate=10 September 2016}}</ref> After the conditions were accepted, the commission issued a 5-year university licence on 16 September 2016.<ref name="ourbeginnings">{{cite web|title=Our Beginnings|url=http://aum.edu.mt/en/article/5/Our-Beginnings|website=American University of Malta|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180106002945/http://aum.edu.mt/en/article/5/Our-Beginnings|archivedate=6 January 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Sadeen granted 5-year licence to run American University of Malta|url=http://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20160919/local/sadeen-granted-5-year-licence-to-run-american-university-of-malta.625569|work=[[Times of Malta]]|date=19 September 2016|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160920185425/http://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20160919/local/sadeen-granted-5-year-licence-to-run-american-university-of-malta.625569|archivedate=20 September 2016}}</ref>
===Criticism=== Some questions have been raised by Maltese media about whether AUM is actually American. This is especially due to the company behind the project being Jordanian. In response to this, AUM's provost John Ryder stated that the university is "not a brand or offshoot, or run by any American university ... [but it is] American in curriculum and organisation."<ref name="times2016-09-25">{{cite news|last1=Sansone|first1=Kurt|title=AUM owner aspires for 'higher education diamond in the Mediterranean'|url=http://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20160925/local/diamond-waiting-to-shine.625996|work=[[Times of Malta]]|date=25 September 2016|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160926161256/http://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20160925/local/diamond-waiting-to-shine.625996|archivedate=26 September 2016}}</ref> The curricula are officially provided by DePaul University, Chicago. A spokesperson for DePaul University issued a statement, qualifying the officiality of AUM’s curricula, saying that; "Faculty designed degree programs in areas that were requested, with the dual goals of being academically well-designed and meeting regulatory requirements in Malta. Individual faculty members were selected with the help of teams -- composed of associate deans, school directors and department chairs -- in the relevant colleges. Faculty then were asked to design the curriculum, and they were compensated for their work," also adding; "[t]he right to use our name (DePaul University) is specifically in connection to the curriculum. While specifics of any DePaul contract are proprietary, I can tell you that it went through the usual, internal multi-step review process."<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.insidehighered.com/news/2015/05/11/questions-raised-about-whether-american-u-malta-really-american|title=Questions raised about whether American U. of Malta is really American {{!}} Inside Higher Ed|date=2015-10-16|access-date=2018-03-06|deadurl=bot: unknown|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151016055439/https://www.insidehighered.com/news/2015/05/11/questions-raised-about-whether-american-u-malta-really-american|archivedate=2015-10-16|df=}}</ref>
Muscat was accused of a lack of transparency with regards to how agreements on the AUM were made, but he responded by saying that the public was informed on the first occasion.<ref>{{cite news|title=‘I can’t see how I can be more transparent’|url=http://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20150517/interview/i-cant-see-how-i-can-be-more-transparent.568415|work=[[Times of Malta]]|date=17 May 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151220212411/http://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20150517/interview/i-cant-see-how-i-can-be-more-transparent.568415|archivedate=20 December 2015}}</ref> NGOs have called for the publication of the agreement between the government and Sadeen Group.<ref>{{cite news|title=NGOs urge publication of Sadeen deal for university|url=http://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20151103/local/ngos-urge-publication-of-sadeen-deal-for-university.590697|work=[[Times of Malta]]|date=3 November 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151220214744/http://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20151103/local/ngos-urge-publication-of-sadeen-deal-for-university.590697|archivedate=20 December 2015}}</ref>
The AUM has also generated controversy with regard to the practicality of having another university in the small country of Malta.<ref>{{cite journal|last1=Mayo|first1=Peter|title=Of Universities, Monopolies, and Public Goods|journal=Think|url=http://www.um.edu.mt/think/of-universities-monopolies-and-public-goods/|publisher=[[University of Malta]]|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151220183841/http://www.um.edu.mt/think/of-universities-monopolies-and-public-goods/|archivedate=20 December 2015}}</ref> The government stated that the AUM would end the monopoly that the [[University of Malta]] has on higher education,<ref>{{cite news|last1=Lindsay|first1=David|title=Government seeking to end University of Malta’s ‘monopoly’|url=http://www.independent.com.mt/articles/2015-05-03/local-news/Government-seeking-to-end-University-of-Malta-s-monopoly-6736134834|work=[[The Malta Independent]]|date=3 May 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150807015710/http://www.independent.com.mt/articles/2015-05-03/local-news/Government-seeking-to-end-University-of-Malta-s-monopoly-6736134834|archivedate=7 August 2015}}</ref> In response to this, lecturers at the University of Malta disagreed with the use of the term "monopoly", stating that the university already competes with other institutions such as [[MCAST]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Lecturers rubbish PM's claim of university monopoly|url=http://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20150520/local/lecturers-rubbish-pms-claim-of-university-monopoly.568972|work=[[Times of Malta]]|date=20 May 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150522183824/http://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20150520/local/lecturers-rubbish-pms-claim-of-university-monopoly.568972|archivedate=22 May 2015}}</ref>
The AUM's early phase, low student intake and initial refusals to release the official enrollment figures became flashpoints of controversy. An early promotional video presented the new university's plan to admit 1,000 students in its first year, eventually reaching a total enrollment of 4,000 students by its fourth year.<ref>{{YouTube|id=Y01mF8p13tk|title=AUM Promo Video}}</ref> The AUM officially began offering classes on Tuesday September 12, 2017, rather than Monday September 11, to avoid association with the [[September 11 attacks]] anniversary.<ref name="maltachamber">{{cite news|title=AUM Opens its Doors to the First Batch of Students|url=http://www.maltachamber.org.mt/page.aspx?rid=8697&preview=1&c=95493AB4B36E9D8D6637317593DB929F7C5700C8&k=-534249962|work=maltachamber.org.mt|date=12 September 2017}}</ref> Asked how many students the AUM admitted for the Fall semester, Provost John Ryder would only say that student recruitment was “proving to be challenging." <ref>{{cite news|last1=Camilleri|first1=Ivan|title=AUM student enrolment is 'proving challenging', provost says|url=https://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20170906/local/aum-student-enrolment-is-proving-challenging-provost-says.657269|work=[[Times of Malta]]|date=6 September 2017}}</ref> In November, the [[Times of Malta]] reported that the AUM's revised plan was to enroll 330 students in its first semester, but the "university managed to attract 15 students"<ref name="timesofmalta1">{{cite news|last1=Camilleri|first1=Ivan|title=AUM firing staff after failing to attract students|url=https://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20171112/local/aum-firing-staff-after-failing-to-attract-students.662834|work=[[Times of Malta]]|date=12 November 2017}}</ref> The figure was denied by university officials.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Schembri Orland|first1=Kevin|title=AUM says it has more than 15 students, but still doesn't divulge number|url=http://www.independent.com.mt/articles/2017-11-19/local-news/AUM-says-it-has-more-than-15-students-but-still-doesn-t-divulge-number-6736181619|work=[[The Malta Independent]]|date=19 November 2017}}</ref> Four days later, Ryder acknowledged in a [[Television Malta]] interview that the AUM student body numbered 23.<ref>{{cite news|title=AUM rector says original targets were not realistic but is confident for the future|url=https://www.tvm.com.mt/en/news/aum-rector-says-original-targets-were-not-realistic-but-is-confident-for-the-future/|work=[[Television Malta]]|date=24 November 2017}}</ref>
AUM personnel decisions have also generated controversy, raising concerns about the legality of the new institution's employment policies and practices. Within a period of 7 months, 10 university employees were terminated, either by [[dismissal (employment)|dismissal]] or resignation: (1) Deputy (Construction Project) Manager (dismissal), (2) Admissions Director (dismissal), (3) Marketing and Public Relations Director (dismissal), (4) Vice President for Administrative Affairs (dismissal), (5) IT Technician (dismissal), (6) Webmaster (resignation), (7) Admissions Counselor (resignation), (8) Human Resources Director (dismissal), (9) Professor of Finance (dismissal) and (10) Dean of Student Affairs (resignation).<ref name="timesofmalta1"/><ref>{{cite news|last1=Diacono|first1=Tim|title=This is What the American University of Malta Looks Like Two Years Later|url=https://lovinmalta.com/news/news-breaking/this-is-what-the-american-university-of-malta-looks-like-two-years-later|work=lovinmalta.com|date=11 November 2017}}</ref> The dismissed deputy manager filed a judicial protest against Sadeen Education.<ref>{{cite news|title=American University of Malta deputy manager says claims against him were fabricated|url=https://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20170523/local/american-university-deputy-manager-says-claims-against-him-were.648810|work=[[Times of Malta]]|date=23 May 2017}}</ref> The former admissions director sued the university for unfair dismissal.<ref>{{cite news|title=Couple file judicial protest claiming unfair dismissal by Sadeen Education Investment Ltd|url=http://www.independent.com.mt/articles/2017-10-20/local-news/Couple-file-judicial-protest-claiming-unfair-dismissal-by-Sadeen-Education-Investment-Ltd-6736180457|work=[[The Malta Independent]]|date=20 October 2017}}</ref> On 4 January 2018, Provost John Ryder informed the twelve remaining AUM faculty members by e-mail that their employment with the university had been terminated without cause.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Diacono|first1=Tim|title=BREAKING: American University of Malta Has Sacked All Its Faculty|url=https://lovinmalta.com/news/news-breaking-american-university-of-malta-has-sacked-it's-faculty|work=lovinmalta.com|date=4 January 2018}}{{Dead link|date=October 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Attard|first1=Rachel|title=AUM full time lecturers said to have been 'dismissed by email'|url=http://www.independent.com.mt/articles/2018-01-04/local-news/AUM-full-time-lectures-said-to-have-been-dismissed-by-email-6736183231|work=[[The Malta Independent]]|date=4 January 2018}}</ref>
Despite the university's small student body, high employee turnover and growing legal troubles, Malta's Education Minister [[Evarist Bartolo]] insisted that the AUM is not a “garage operation” <ref>{{cite news|last1=Grech|first1=Helena|title=Minister would rather see the American University of Malta 'start small, grow gradually'|url=http://www.independent.com.mt/articles/2017-11-13/local-news/Education-Minister-would-rather-see-AUM-start-small-grow-gradually-6736181366|work=[[The Malta Independent]]|date=13 November 2017}}</ref>
Other sources of controversy include allegations of legal and ethical wrongdoing by members of the AUM's board of trustees. The board members are (1) [[Prince Jean of Luxembourg]] (chair), (2) John Ryder (ex officio), (3) Taddeo Scerri (Chairman of the Board at the [[Bank of Valletta]]), (4) Hani Salah (Chief Executive Officer of Sadeen Group), (5) [[Taher al-Masri]], (6) [[Derrick Gosselin]] and (7) Adrian Hillman (former Allied Group managing director).<ref name="timesofmalta2">{{cite news|last1=Camilleri|first1=Ivan|title=American University of Malta appoints Adrian Hillman as trustee|url=https://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20171029/local/american-university-of-malta-appoints-adrian-hillman-as-trustee.661617|work=[[Times of Malta]]|date=29 October 2017}}</ref> Hillman was appointed while under criminal investigation for laundering money and receiving kickbacks from the Maltese Prime Minister's chief of staff [[Keith Schembri]], who has been implicated in a tax evasion scheme by the [[Panama Papers]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Allied Group managing director Adrian Hillman denies allegations|url=https://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20160313/local/allied-group-managing-director-adrian-hillman-denies-allegations.605632|work=[[Times of Malta]]|date=13 March 2016}}</ref><ref name="timesofmalta2"/> Scerri was accused of ignoring conflicts of interest between his AUM board appointment and his current and past professional positions in Malta's financial sector.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Camilleri|first1=Ivan|title=No conflict of interest with American University of Malta appointment, says BOV chair|url=https://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20171103/local/no-conflict-of-interest-with-american-university-of-malta.662085|work=[[Times of Malta]]|date=3 November 2017}}</ref>

{{Unreferenced|date=November 2018}} In [[mechanical engineering]], the '''Beale number''' is a parameter that characterizes the performance of '''[[Stirling engine]]s'''. It is often used to estimate the power output of a Stirling engine design. For engines operating with a high temperature differential, typical values for the Beale number range from ( 0.11 ) to ( 0.15 ); where a larger number indicates higher performance.
==Definition== The Beale number can be defined in terms of a Stirling engine's operating parameters:
:<math>B_n = \frac{Wo}{P V F} </math>
where: *'''B<sub>n</sub>''' is the Beale number *'''Wo''' is the power output of the engine ([[watt]]s) *'''P''' is the [[Arithmetic mean|mean average]] gas [[pressure]] ([[Pascal (unit)|Pa]]) or ([[MPa]], if volume is in [[centimeters|cm<sup>3</sup>]]) *'''V''' is swept [[volume]] of the power piston([[meters|m<sup>3</sup>]]) or ([[centimeters|cm<sup>3</sup>]], if pressure is in [[MPa]]) *'''F''' is the engine cycle frequency ([[Hertz|Hz]])
==Estimating Stirling power== To estimate the power output of an engine, nominal values are assumed for the Beale number, pressure, swept volume and frequency, then the power is calculated as the product of these parameters, as follows:
<!-- Power = (Beale number) x (mean pressure) x (Swept volume of power piston) x (Frequency) --> :<math>Wo = \frac{}{}B_n P V F </math>
==See also== * [[West number]]
==External links== * [http://www.bekkoame.ne.jp/~khirata/academic/simple/simplee.htm Stirling Engine Performance Calculator] * [http://www.fxsolver.com/browse/formulas/Beale+number Beale number calculator]

'''Beam's Eye View''' (or '''BEV''') is an imaging technique used in [[radiation therapy]] for the quality assurance and planning of External Beam Radiation Therapy treatments. These are primarily used to ensure that the relative orientation of the patient and the treatment machine are correct. The BEV image will typically contain the images of the patient's anatomy and the beam modifiers (such as jaws or Multi-Leaf Collimators (or MLCs)).
==Generation of Beam's Eye Views== * Physical Construction: ** BEV's can be generated by exposing a high energy film (similar to [[photographic film]]) or an Electronic Portal Imaging Device (EPID) with the treatment beam itself after it passes through the patient and any beam modifiers (such as blocks). Although this type of image is an excellent indication of the basic quality of the treatment plan, the quality of film images can be poor. ** A BEV can be created using a radiation therapy simulator which mimics the treatment geometry (couch angle, gantry angle, etc.) using an [[X-ray]] source instead of the higher energy treatment source. The jaws and blocks can be imaged on the same film as the patient's landmarks. * Artificial Reconstruction: The BEV can be created using a [[Digitally Reconstructed Radiograph]] (or DRR) that is created from a computed tomography (or CT) data set. This image would contain the same treatment plan information, but the patient image is reconstructed from the CT image data using a physics model.
==References== * Faiz Kahn and Roger Potish (Eds.) (1998).''Treatment Planning in Radiation Oncology''. Williams & Wilkins. {{ISBN|0-683-04607-1}}. * Jacob Van Dyk (Ed.) (1999). ''The Modern Technology of Radiation Oncology''. Medical Physics Publishing. {{ISBN|0-944838-38-3}}.

A '''caption contest''' or '''caption competition''' is a competition between multiple participants, who are required to give the best description for a certain [[image]] offered by the [[Competition|contest]] organizer. Rules and information about the competition process are also given by the competition organizer.
== General information == Caption contest participants have to describe a given image as accurately and [[originality|originally]] as possible. Contests may vary by image type ([[photograph|photo]] or [[drawing]]), [[Photo caption|caption]] format ([[description]] of a situation or a [[dialogue]]), as well as [[judgement|judging]] criteria. The competition organizer is required to give information about caption submission rules and other information that is important for the contest.
Caption contests are mainly arranged as an [[amusement]], and they can be organized under different conditions (between separate individuals, in public events, [[mass media]], etc.), as well as using various means (drawn pictures on paper, digital image, printed image, press publication, etc.). Traditionally, the most popular and typical format has been publication of caption contests in [[newspaper]]s or [[magazine]]s, but with the development of modern technologies, it is also very popular to organize caption contests on the [[Internet]].
Caption contests can be used not only as an [[entertainment]] but also for other purposes, such as newspaper promotion, bringing forward a certain [[problem]], or product [[advertising|advertisement]]. An important aspect of caption competition is to look at an object, event or issue from unusual point of view.
The caption, unless competition rules do not restrict, can be in any form of literary expression - [[prose]], [[poetry]], as one [[word]] or a [[word play]]. Usually the submitted captions are judged by the originality and [[wit]], but not always the decisive assessment is [[humour]]. It is generally assumed that the caption has to describe image as precisely as possible, so both humour and precision are equally important.
As caption writing is an [[art]] of words, it is rarely possible to evaluate the superiority of one caption over others accurately and [[objectivity (philosophy)|objectively]]. Consequently, the judging of submitted captions is usually quite [[subjectivity|subjective]]. Sometimes competition rules limit caption size, but usually the caption is no longer than one [[sentence (linguistics)|sentence]] (10 - 20 words). As an exception, the caption can consist of several sentences. Usually it is not allowed to use [[profanity|profane]] or offensive language in submitted captions.
In several caption contests, [[champion|winners]] are awarded with [[prize]]s.
== History == It is considered that the origins of caption contests are related to the increase of [[popularity]] of [[cartoon]]s and [[comics]] as well as widespread use of [[illustration]]s and the rise of [[photojournalism]] in printed media at the end of the 19th century. All these areas share the combination of words and images that could be multiplied and made available to a wide audience with the beginnings of mass printing and wide spread of newspapers and magazines.<ref>[https://www.nytimes.com/1995/11/20/business/earlier-media-achieved-critical-mass-printing-press-yelling-stop-presses-didn-t.html D. J. R. Bruckner. "How the Earlier Media Achieved Critical Mass." ''The New York Times'', November 20, 1995.]</ref>
From currently available information, the first caption contests in printed media appeared in the [[United States|U.S.]] press of the late 19th century (such as ''[[Life (magazine)|Life]]'' magazine<ref>[http://chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83030214/1920-11-07/ed-1/seq-25/ "$1000.00 in Prizes." ''New-York tribune'', November 07, 1920.] chroniclingamerica.loc.gov. Retrieved May 31, 2012.</ref> which was published from year 1883 to 1936). At that time these competitions were called ''picture title'' or ''picture headline'' contests, but their concept and meaning was identical to current caption contests. It must be considered, that the term ''caption'' in its present sense firstly appeared in [[English language]] only in the first half of the 20th century.<ref>http://www.etymonline.com/index.php?term=caption&allowed_in_frame=0 Retrieved May 31, 2012.</ref>
In the beginning of the 20th century, at least in the U.S. press (for example, ''[[The San Francisco Call]]'',<ref>[http://chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn85066387/1912-01-07/ed-1/seq-17/ "The Sunday Call Will Pay $20 for the Best Title for This Picture." ''The San Francisco call'', January 07, 1912.] chroniclingamerica.loc.gov. Retrieved May 31, 2012.</ref> ''[[Daily News (New York)|The Daily News]]'',<ref>[http://chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83030214/1920-03-23/ed-1/seq-11/ "What does this Picture mean?" ''New-York tribune'', March 23, 1920, p.11.] chroniclingamerica.loc.gov. Retrieved May 31, 2012.</ref> ''[[Connecticut Post|The Bridgeport Telegram]]''<ref>[https://newspaperarchive.com/bridgeport-telegram/1921-12-20/page-30/ "$10 A Week for the Best Titles in Sunday Post Caption Contest" ''Bridgeport Telegram'', December 20, 1921, p.30.] newspaperarchive.com. Retrieved May 31, 2012.</ref>) caption contests were already quite popular. In these competitions drawn pictures and cartoons were mainly used. [[Photo caption]] contests appeared little later with the improvement of printing quality (towards the second quarter of 20th century).
During the course of the 20th century, caption contests were published in printed media in many countries of the world. For example, in Soviet Union one of the first caption contests was published in daily newspaper ''Izvestia'' Sunday supplement ''Nedelya'' (''The Week'') at the beginning of the 1960s.<ref>[http://www.odnako.org/magazine/material/show_14096/ "Золотой глаз-Геолог и Мальтус".] odnako.org. Retrieved June 21, 2012.</ref> Little later a newspaper ''Literaturnaya gazeta'' began to publish caption contests that became very popular and they are part of this newspaper up until now.<ref>[http://www.lgz.ru/article/18729/ "Что бы это значило?".] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120620052849/http://www.lgz.ru/article/18729/# |date=2012-06-20 }} lgz.ru. Retrieved June 21, 2012.</ref>
The spread of caption contests increased even more with the emergence of the Internet by the end of the 20th century, and at the beginning of the 21st century. Internet has made the organization of caption contests and participation in them possible for wide audiences across the world.
== Present situation == Although a considerable amount of caption contests are now on Internet, caption contests in printed media still exist and are quite popular. A very popular and prominent is a weekly caption contest published in American magazine ''[[New Yorker (magazine)|The New Yorker]]''.<ref name="a">[https://www.wsj.com/articles/SB10001424053111904199404576538831896448132 Russell Adams. "How About Never-Is Never Good for You?" ''The Wall Street Journal'', September 10, 2011.]</ref> The contest first appeared in 1998 and has been published regularly in each issue since 2005.<ref>[http://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2005/05/02/your-caption-here Your Caption Here] The New Yorker. 2 May 2005.</ref> Each week several thousand participants take part in this competition.<ref>[http://www.newyorker.com/cartoons/bob-mankoff/seven-reasons-why-hard-to-win-caption-contest Seven Reasons It's Hard To Win The Caption Contest] Mankoff, Robert. 8 November 2014.</ref> On the Internet, a very popular is the weekly caption competition on ''[[BBC]]'' website (''[[BBC News Magazine Monitor|Magazine Monitor]]'' section), held since 2006.
Along the traditional caption contests, there have appeared different forms of this [[genre]] such as anti-caption contests<ref name="a" /> for worst submitted caption and reverse caption contests where the most suitable picture must be submitted for a given caption. There are also caption contests devoted to particular themes such as [[history]]<ref>[http://blogs.archives.gov/prologue/?p=9388 "Thursday Photo Caption Contest"] blogs.archives.gov. Retrieved May 31, 2012.</ref> or [[association football|football]].<ref>[http://www.footytube.com/forums/funny-football/the-silly-captions-competition-2770/ "The Silly Captions Competition"] footytube.com. Retrieved May 31, 2012.</ref>
In 2006, the website caption.me <ref>http://www.caption.me/</ref> (then captioncompetition.co.uk) was founded, featuring amusing photos loaded automatically from photo-sharing site [[Flickr]]. Visitors submit captions and vote for others. Caption.Me features a real-time collaborative mind-mapping feature called [http://www.caption.me/forum/discussion/557/maption-is-live#Item_0 Maption]
In 2009, there was released an online multiplayer caption writing game called ''[[Caption That (Game)|Caption That]]'' where players write captions for a given image and then vote for their favourite from the list others have written.<ref>http://www.captionthat.com {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120219001151/http://www.captionthat.com/ |date=2012-02-19}}</ref>
In 2014, the iPhone app [http://www.captionit.co Captionit] was released on the Apple App Store. Captionit is a free mobile app that allows people to play and create caption contests on their iPhone, iPad, and iPod Touch.<ref>[http://www.sbwire.com/press-releases/waste-your-creativity-with-captionits-new-iphone-app-483131.htm/ Waste Your Creativity with Captionit's New Iphone App"] SBWire, March 26, 2014.</ref><ref>http://www.captionit.co/</ref>
In 2016, mobile phone application [http://tinnbin.com TinnBin] was released for both iPhone and Android. TinnBin users create contests called "Bins" by uploading a picture from their device and selecting how long they would like the contest to run. While the bin is open, users can add and vote on comments, called "Tinns". Once the bin is closed, the winning tinn is appended to the image in the form of a caption. TinnBin is different from most other caption contests as the winner is chosen strictly by users of the application, and not the contest creators, and all the contests are created by users of the application.<ref>http://www.tinnbin.com/</ref>
''The New Yorker'' magazine, noting the popularity of its cartoon caption contest, has created a caption contest [[board game]]<ref>[https://archive.is/20120731102549/http://www.familyandpartygames.com/pdf/NY_instructions.pdf/ "The New Yorker Cartoon caption game"] familyandpartygames.com. Retrieved May 31, 2012.</ref> and issued a book with the most interesting cartoons and winning captions as well as comprehensive information covering this theme.<ref>Mankoff, Robert (2008). [https://books.google.com/books?id=ckSXGMV2UJYC&printsec=frontcover&hl=en#v=onepage&q&f=false ''The New Yorker Cartoon Caption Contest Book''] Kansas City: Andrews McMeel Publishing. {{ISBN|0-7407-7750-5}}.</ref>
Also concerning the ''New Yorker'' caption contest, several scientific studies have been carried out: researchers from [[University of New Mexico]], Department of Anthropology, in 2010 have compared humour ability in males and females in context of this competition;<ref>{{cite journal | url = http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0160289611000523/ | doi=10.1016/j.intell.2011.03.006 | volume=39 | title=Humor ability reveals intelligence, predicts mating success, and is higher in males | journal=Intelligence | pages=188–192}}</ref> members of ''The New Yorker'' editorial board and [[University of Colorado at Boulder|University of Colorado Boulder]] [[Leeds School of Business]] in 2011 analysed several thousand entries of this contest to study the concept of humour.<ref>[http://leeds.colorado.edu/news/113 Leeds School of Business "What It Takes To Win The New Yorker`s Cartoon Caption Contest"] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121204013344/http://leeds.colorado.edu/news/113 |date=December 4, 2012}} leeds.colorado.edu, April 25, 2011.</ref>
== Future perspectives == The future of caption contests depends on the [[imagination]] and [[creativity]] of their organizers and participants, as well as future development of information and [[Information and communications technology|communication technologies]].
== In popular culture == In U.S. TV series ''[[The Office (U.S. TV series)|The Office]]'', seventh-season episode ''[[The Search (The Office)|The Search]]'',<ref>[http://www.nbc.com/the-office/episode-guide/season-7/42801/the-search/episode-715/281549/ "The Search".] "The Office" episode guide. nbc.com. Retrieved May 31, 2012.</ref> its character [[Pam Beesly|Pam]] starts a caption contest in the office, with her co-worker [[Gabe Lewis|Gabe]] instituting rules that no one wants to follow.
In [[British sitcom]] ''[[Green Wing]]'', the second series, episode six, its character [[Alan Statham]] wins a caption competition on the ''Consultant Radiologists International'' website, an organisation of which Alan claims to be an "Esteemed member".<ref>[http://www.tv.com/shows/green-wing/episodes/ "Episode 6 – Season 2".] "Green Wing" episode guide. tv.com. Retrieved June 3, 2012.</ref>
In a children's novel ''[[Absolute Zero (novel)|Absolute Zero]]'' by [[Helen Cresswell]] its character Uncle Parker has won a trip to the [[Caribbean]] in a caption contest. The rest of the family immediately enter similar competitions in an attempt to better his prize but, much of the time, beating the others to an entry form is a victory in itself.
In season two of the [[HBO]] series ''[[Bored to Death]]'', George (played by [[Ted Danson]]) struggles to caption a New Yorker cartoon, which portrays a police duck interacting with a suicidal bear.

[https://www.amazon.com/Complete-Idiots-Guide-Comedy-Writing/dp/1592572316#reader_1592572316 ''The Complete Idiot's Guide to Comedy Writing''.] Indianapolis: Alpha Books. {{ISBN|1-4406-9048-0}}. * Sale, Jonathan (1981). ''If the Caption Fits: The Best of the Punch Caption Competition''. London: Elm Tree Books. {{ISBN|0-241-10668-0}}. * Glasser, Selma (1980). ''The Complete Guide to Prize Contests, Sweepstakes, and How to Win Them''. New York: F. Fell Publishers. {{ISBN|0811903273}}. * LaRocque, Paul (2003). [https://books.google.com/books?id=ekyU8CoNwNwC&printsec=frontcover&hl=en#v=onepage&q&f=false ''Heads You Win!: An Easy Guide to Better Headline and Caption Writing''.] Portland: Marion Street Press. {{ISBN|0-9729937-0-3}}.

'''Chemogenetics''' is the processes by which [[macromolecule]]s can be engineered to interact with previously unrecognized small molecules. Chemogenetics as a term was originally coined to describe the observed effects of mutations on [[chalcone isomerase]] activity on substrate specificities in the flowers of ''[[Dianthus caryophyllus]]''.<ref>{{cite journal | vauthors = Forkmann G, Dangelmayr B | title = Genetic control of chalcone isomerase activity in flowers of Dianthus caryophyllus | journal = Biochemical Genetics | volume = 18 | issue = 5-6 | pages = 519–27 | date = June 1980 | pmid = 7437010 | doi = 10.1007/bf00484399 }}</ref> This method is very similar to [[optogenetics]] however, it uses chemically engineered molecules and ligands instead of light and light-sensitive channels known as [[Opsin]]s.
In recent research projects, chemogenetics has been widely used to understand the relationship between brain activity and behavior. Prior to chemogenetics, researchers used methods such as [[Transcranial magnetic stimulation|transcranial magnetic stimulation (TMS)]] and [[Deep brain stimulation|deep brain stimulation (DBS)]] to study the relationship between neuronal activity and behavior.<ref name=":0">{{cite journal | vauthors = Dobrzanski G, Kossut M | title = Application of the DREADD technique in biomedical brain research | journal = Pharmacological Reports | volume = 69 | issue = 2 | pages = 213–221 | date = April 2017 | pmid = 28092807 | doi = 10.1016/j.pharep.2016.10.015 }}</ref>
== Comparison to optogenetics == [[Optogenetics]] and chemogenetics are the more recent and popular methods used to study this relationship. Both of these methods target specific brain circuits and cell population to influence cell activity. However, they use different procedures to accomplish this task. Optogenetics uses light-sensitive channels and pumps that are virally introduced into neurons. Cells' activity, having these channels, can then be manipulated by light. Chemogenetics, on the other hand, uses chemically engineered receptors and exogenous molecules specific for those receptors, to affect the activity of those cells. The engineered macromolecules used to design these receptors include [[Nucleic acid hybridization|nucleic acid hybrids]],<ref>{{cite journal | vauthors = Strobel SA, Ortoleva-Donnelly L, Ryder SP, Cate JH, Moncoeur E | title = Complementary sets of noncanonical base pairs mediate RNA helix packing in the group I intron active site | journal = Nature Structural Biology | volume = 5 | issue = 1 | pages = 60–6 | date = January 1998 | pmid = 9437431 | doi = 10.1038/nsb0198-60 }}</ref> [[kinase]]s,<ref>{{cite journal | vauthors = Bishop AC, Shah K, Liu Y, Witucki L, Kung C, Shokat KM | title = Design of allele-specific inhibitors to probe protein kinase signaling | journal = Current Biology | volume = 8 | issue = 5 | pages = 257–66 | date = February 1998 | pmid = 9501066 | doi = 10.1016/s0960-9822(98)70198-8 }}</ref> variety of [[Metabolism|metabolic enzymes]],<ref>{{cite journal | vauthors = Collot J, Gradinaru J, Humbert N, Skander M, Zocchi A, Ward TR | title = Artificial metalloenzymes for enantioselective catalysis based on biotin-avidin | journal = Journal of the American Chemical Society | volume = 125 | issue = 30 | pages = 9030–1 | date = July 2003 | pmid = 15369356 | doi = 10.1021/ja035545i }}</ref><ref>{{cite journal | vauthors = Häring D, Distefano MD | title = Enzymes by design: chemogenetic assembly of transamination active sites containing lysine residues for covalent catalysis | journal = Bioconjugate Chemistry | volume = 12 | issue = 3 | pages = 385–90 | year = 2001 | pmid = 11353536 | doi = 10.1021/bc000117c }}</ref> and G-protein coupled receptors (GPCRs) such as [[Receptor activated solely by a synthetic ligand|DREADDs]].<ref>{{cite journal | vauthors = Strader CD, Gaffney T, Sugg EE, Candelore MR, Keys R, Patchett AA, Dixon RA | title = Allele-specific activation of genetically engineered receptors | journal = The Journal of Biological Chemistry | volume = 266 | issue = 1 | pages = 5–8 | date = January 1991 | pmid = 1670767 }}</ref><ref>{{cite journal | vauthors = Coward P, Wada HG, Falk MS, Chan SD, Meng F, Akil H, Conklin BR | title = Controlling signaling with a specifically designed Gi-coupled receptor | journal = Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America | volume = 95 | issue = 1 | pages = 352–7 | date = January 1998 | pmid = 9419379 | doi = 10.1073/pnas.95.1.352 }}</ref><ref>{{cite journal |doi=10.1016/s0223-5234(99)80094-4 |title=Engineering a region of bulk tolerance in the 5-HT2A receptor |journal=European Journal of Medicinal Chemistry |volume=34 |issue=5 |pages=441–447 |year=1999 |last1=Westkaemper |first1=Richard B |last2=Hyde |first2=Edward G |last3=Choudhary |first3=Mohammad S |last4=Khan |first4=Naseem |last5=Gelbar |first5=Edward I |last6=Glennon |first6=Richard A |last7=Roth |first7=Bryan L | name-list-format = vanc }}</ref><ref>{{cite journal | vauthors = Armbruster BN, Li X, Pausch MH, Herlitze S, Roth BL | title = Evolving the lock to fit the key to create a family of G protein-coupled receptors potently activated by an inert ligand | journal = Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America | volume = 104 | issue = 12 | pages = 5163–8 | date = March 2007 | pmid = 17360345 | pmc = 1829280 | doi = 10.1073/pnas.0700293104 }}</ref>
DREADDs are the most common [[G protein–coupled receptor|GPCRs]] used in chemogenetics.<ref>{{cite journal | vauthors = Roth BL | title = DREADDs for Neuroscientists | journal = Neuron | volume = 89 | issue = 4 | pages = 683–94 | date = February 2016 | pmid = 26889809 | pmc = 4759656 | doi = 10.1016/j.neuron.2016.01.040 }}</ref> These receptors solely get activated by the drug of interest (inert molecule) and influence physiological and neural processes that take place within and outside of the central nervous system.
Chemogenetics has recently been favored over Optogenetics, and it avoids some of the challenges of Optogenetics. Chemogenetics does not require the expensive light equipment, and therefore, is more accessible. The resolution in Optogenetic declines due to light scattering and illuminance declined levels as the distance between the subject and the light source increases.These factors, therefore, don’t allow for all cells to be affected by light and lead to a lower spatial resolution. Chemogenetics, however, does not require light usage and therefore can achieve a higher spatial resolution.<ref name=":4">{{cite journal | vauthors = Montgomery KL, Yeh AJ, Ho JS, Tsao V, Mohan Iyer S, Grosenick L, Ferenczi EA, Tanabe Y, Deisseroth K, Delp SL, Poon AS | title = Wirelessly powered, fully internal optogenetics for brain, spinal and peripheral circuits in mice | journal = Nature Methods | volume = 12 | issue = 10 | pages = 969–74 | date = October 2015 | pmid = 26280330 | pmc = 5507210 | doi = 10.1038/nmeth.3536 }}</ref>
==Applications== GPCRs' usage and chemogenetics are nowadays the targets for many of the pharmaceutical companies to cure and alleviate symptoms of diseases that involve all tissues of the body.<ref>{{cite journal | vauthors = Smith RS, Hu R, DeSouza A, Eberly CL, Krahe K, Chan W, Araneda RC | title = Differential Muscarinic Modulation in the Olfactory Bulb | journal = The Journal of Neuroscience | volume = 35 | issue = 30 | pages = 10773–85 | date = July 2015 | pmid = 26224860 | pmc = 4518052 | doi = 10.1523/JNEUROSCI.0099-15.2015 }}</ref> More specifically, DREADDs have been used to explore treatment options for various neurodegenerative and psychological conditions such as Parkinson’s disease, depression, anxiety, and addiction. These aforementioned conditions involve processes that occur within and outside of the nervous system involving neurotransmitters such as [[Gamma-Aminobutyric acid|GABA]] and [[Glutamic acid|Glutamate]].<ref name=":1">{{cite journal | vauthors = Volkow ND, Koob GF, McLellan AT | title = Neurobiologic Advances from the Brain Disease Model of Addiction | journal = The New England Journal of Medicine | volume = 374 | issue = 4 | pages = 363–71 | date = January 2016 | pmid = 26816013 | doi = 10.1056/nejmra1511480 }}</ref> Chemogenetics has therefore been used in pharmacology to adjust the levels of such neurotransmitters in specific neuron while minimizing the side effects of treatment. To treat and relieve the symptoms of any disease using the DREADDs, these receptors are delivered to the area of interest via viral transduction.
Recently some studies have considered using a new method called retro DREADDs. This method allows specific neuronal pathways to be studied under cellular resolution. Unlike classic DREADDs, this method is usually used in wild type animals, and these receptors are given to the targeted cells via injection of two viral vectors.<ref name=":0" />
=== Animal Models === DREADDS have been used in many animal models (e.g., mice and other non-primate animals) to target and influence the activity of various cells . Chemogenetics used in animals assists with demonstrating human disease models such as [[Parkinson's disease]]. Having this information allows scientists understand whether viral expression of DREADD proteins, both in-vivo enhancers and inhibitors of neuronal function can be used to bidirectionally affect the behaviors and the activity of the involved neurons. Recent studies have shown that DREADDs were successfully used to treat the motor deficits of rats modeling Parkinson's disease.<ref name=":2">{{cite journal | vauthors = Pienaar IS, Gartside SE, Sharma P, De Paola V, Gretenkord S, Withers D, Elson JL, Dexter DT | title = Pharmacogenetic stimulation of cholinergic pedunculopontine neurons reverses motor deficits in a rat model of Parkinson's disease | journal = Molecular Neurodegeneration | volume = 10 | pages = 47 | date = September 2015 | pmid = 26394842 | pmc = 4580350 | doi = 10.1186/s13024-015-0044-5 }}</ref> Other studies have had successes linking the usage of DREADDs and influencing drug seeking and drug sensitization behavior.<ref name=":1" />
The progression of Chemogenetics from rodents to non-human primates has been slow due to increased demand in time and expense surrounding these projects.However, some recent studies in 2016 have been able to demonstrate successes showing that silencing the activity of neurons in the [[Orbitofrontal cortex]] along with the removal of [[Rhinal cortex]], restricted the reward task performance in macaques.<ref name=":3">{{cite journal | vauthors = Galvan A, Caiola MJ, Albaugh DL | title = Advances in optogenetic and chemogenetic methods to study brain circuits in non-human primates | journal = Journal of Neural Transmission | volume = 125 | issue = 3 | pages = 547–563 | date = March 2018 | pmid = 28238201 | pmc = 5572535 | doi = 10.1007/s00702-017-1697-8 }}</ref>
== Limitation and future directions == Chemogenetics and usage of DREADDs have allowed researchers to advance in biomedical research areas including many [[Neurodegeneration|neurodegenerative]] and psychiatric conditions. Chemogenetics have been used in these fields to induce specific and reversible brain lesions and therefore, study specific activities of neuron population. Although Chemogenetics offers specificity and high spatial resolution, it still faces some challenges when used in investigating [[Neuropsychiatry|neuropsychiatric]] disorders. Neuropsychiatric disorders usually have a complex nature where lesions in the brain have not been identified as the main cause. Chemogenetics has been used to reverse some of the deficits revolving such conditions however, it hasn’t been able to identify the main cause of neuropsychiatric diseases and cure these conditions completely due to complex nature of these conditions. Nevertheless, chemogenetics has been used successfully in a preclinical model of drug-resistant [[Gene therapy for epilepsy|epilepsy]], where seizures arise from a discrete part of the brain.<ref>{{cite journal | vauthors = Kätzel D, Nicholson E, Schorge S, Walker MC, Kullmann DM | title = Chemical-genetic attenuation of focal neocortical seizures | journal = Nature Communications | volume = 5 | pages = 3847 | date = May 2014 | pmid = 24866701 | pmc = 4050272 | doi = 10.1038/ncomms4847 }}</ref>
== References == {{Reflist}}
